#lakitu#procreate#pastel
andykais

I love this game!!! The beautiful soundtrack, the cute art style that plays excellently against the game's tone, the slow solem storytelling that has such scale, but makes each character interaction feel so personal, and tiny. Gosh I just really like it, you know?

Anyways I had to pay it some homage. I found that using texture overlays and removing the outlines in some places helped the drawing feel less rigid and more soft. Very happy with how it turned out!

#hollow knight#team cherry#greenpath#sharpie#procreate
andykais

Sputter! I’m so excited I get to see a manga I read get adapted into an anime! I didn’t even intend to make this little guy related to the anime, but after I conjured this green fireball, his face just fit so well...

andykais

I really love line art that hints at something requiring much more detail, like how I've alluded to fur with a few open patches in the outline. It's a case of minimal effort that let's your eyes do all the hard work 🐀

Anyway, I've gotten back into digital art making and found drawing tables to be super intuitive and fun! If only I knew how to pick proper color palettes...

#procreate#animals#smol boy

I’m studying to be a web developer by trade so I’ve got a soft spot for flat design, here’s some Marcy and Finn vector images! I think they’re cooler without faces but I did try to put faces on them (you don’t wanna see those)

#Adventure Time#inkscape#flat design#marcy#finn
andykais

freshman year I took a course on fractal theory, all about the patterns that exist in apparent randomness. It got me tinkering. I wanted to randomly create something cool out of static like this first image.

I played with a lot of methods and made hundreds of these little pixel squares, but what really stuck was this cool cascading color effect.

what I did was tell the colors to randomly advance all the way to 255 on a rbg scale and then reset to zero. Not that I made any ground breaking discovery but to me, using math to make art out of some random pixels is very cool.

R 0 -> 3  -> 8  ... 254 -> 1 G 0 -> 10 -> 15 ... 233 -> 237 B 0 -> 5  -> 9  ... 249 -> 252
#procedural generation#python#pixel art#code
